data.enText: giving and receiving
an act of giving sth to sb or doing sth for sb and receiving sth in return
The exchange of prisoners took place this morning.

data.chText: 我们需要促进思想和信息的公开交流。
data.enText: We need to promote an open exchange of ideas and information.
an exchange of glances/insults
an exchange of fire (= between enemy soldiers)

data.chText: 我请你吃午饭，你给我修计算机，这算是公平交易吧？
data.enText: I buy you lunch and you fix my computer. Is that a fair exchange ?

data.chText: 用我的旧电视机换这架照相机，你愿意吗？
data.enText: Would you like my old TV in exchange for this camera?

data.chText: 如果你愿意代我照看孩子，我就把这个报告给你打出来。
data.enText: I'll type your report if you'll babysit in exchange .
conversation/argument
a conversation or an argument
There was only time for a brief exchange.

data.chText: 首相参与了和下院反对党议员的激烈争论。
data.enText: The Prime Minister was involved in a heated exchange with opposition MPs.
of money
the process of changing an amount of one currency (= the money used in one country) for an equal value of another
currency exchange facilities

data.chText: 在什么地方才能获得最好的兑换价？
data.enText: Where can I find the best exchange rate / rate of exchange ?
between two countries

data.chText: （不同国家人或团体之间的）交流，互访
data.enText: an arrangement when two people or groups from different countries visit each other's homes or do each other's jobs for a short time

data.chText: 我们学校与法国的一所学校进行交流。
data.enText: Our school does an exchange with a school in France.

data.chText: 尼克到法国去作互访了。
data.enText: Nick went on the French exchange.

data.chText: 与中国的贸易和文化交流
data.enText: trade and cultural exchanges with China
building
a building where business people met in the past to buy and sell a particular type of goods
the old Corn Exchange
telephone
give and receive
to give sth to sb and at the same time receive the same type of thing from them

data.chText: 交流思想；互通消息；交流信息
data.enText: to exchange ideas/news/information

data.chText: 朱丽叶和戴维相互看了看对方。
data.enText: Juliet and David exchanged glances (= they looked at each other) .

data.chText: 我与经理握手，相互交谈了几句。
data.enText: I shook hands and exchanged a few words with the manager.

data.chText: 两个男人相互殴打起来。
data.enText: The two men exchanged blows (= hit each other) .

data.chText: 所有的组员都相互交换了电子邮件地址。
data.enText: Everyone in the group exchanged email addresses.
money/goods
to give or return sth that you have and get sth different or better instead

data.chText: 你可在旅馆把你的钱兑换成美元。
data.enText: You can exchange your currency for dollars in the hotel.

data.chText: 如果不合适就把它拿回来，商店将给你掉换。
data.enText: If it doesn't fit, take it back and the store will exchange it.
contracts

data.chText: 交换（尤指房屋或土地买卖的契约）
data.enText: to sign a contract with the person that you are buying sth from, especially a house or land
have/exchange words (with sb) (about sth)
to have an argument with sb
We've had words.
Words were exchanged.

means: 交换(尤指房屋或土地买卖的契约)

ex.chText: 玛丽同露西交换了外套。
在会上，双方就此问题交换了意见。
ex.enText: Both sides exchanged their opinions on the issue at the meeting.

synonyms.bx: 通常指互相交换同类东西。

ex.chText: 作为经理，他经常与员工交换意见。
ex.enText: As a manager, he often interchanges ideas with his workers.

ex.chText: 这两个朋友每周都有信件往来。
ex.enText: The two friends interchange letters each week.

synonyms.bx: 侧重指交流思想、信息或交换位置等。

ex.chText: 咱俩的玻璃杯对调了——这个是我的。
ex.enText: Our glasses have been switched/exchanged - this is mine.

ex.chText: 你愿意用你的马换我的汽车吗？
ex.enText: Will you switch/exchange your horse for my car?

synonyms.bx: 多用于口语，常可与 exchange 换用，但侧重于调换之意。

ex.chText: 他经常通过电话或网络进行交易。
ex.enText: He usually trades by phone or online.
She traded her books for his CDs.

synonyms.bx: 尤指买卖货物，也可表示交换物品。

data.enText: have/exchange words (with sb) (about sth)
to have an argument with sb
We've had words.
Words were exchanged.

tr: (chess) the capture by both players (usually on consecutive moves) of pieces of equal value
example: the endgame began after the exchange of queens

tr: (chess) gaining (or losing) a rook in return for a knight or bishop
the act of putting one thing or person in the place of another: "he sent Smith in for Jones but the substitution came too late to help"
reciprocal transfer of equivalent sums of money (especially the currencies of different countries)
example: he earns his living from the interchange of currency

tr: the act of giving something in return for something received
example: deductible losses on sales or exchanges of property are allowable

tr: the act of changing one thing for another thing
example: Adam was promised immortality in exchange for his disobedience
there was an interchange of prisoners

tr: (sports) an unbroken sequence of several successive strokes
example: after a short rally Connors won the point

tr: a workplace that serves as a telecommunications facility where lines from telephones can be connected together to permit communication
a workplace for buying and selling
a mutual expression of views (especially an unpleasant one)
chemical process in which one atom or ion or group changes places with another
change over, change around, as to a new order or sequence
exchange or replace with another, usually of the same kind or category
example: Could you convert my dollars into pounds?

tr: exchange a penalty for a less severe one
give to, and receive from, one another
example: Would you change places with me?
We have been exchanging letters for a year

tr: put in the place of another
example: the con artist replaced the original with a fake Rembrandt
substitute regular milk with fat-free milk
synonyms can be interchanged without a changing the context's meaning

tr: hand over one and receive another, approximately equivalent
example: exchange employees between branches of the company

value.def: If two or more people exchange things of a particular kind, they give them to each other at the same time.

example.ex: We exchanged addresses and Christmas cards...
example.tran: 我们交换了地址和圣诞贺卡。
那两个男人互相扫了一眼。

example.ex: He exchanged a quick smile with her then entered the lift.
example.tran: 他和她匆匆相视一笑，然后走进了电梯。

example.ex: He ruled out any exchange of prisoners with the militants.
example.tran: 他拒绝和武装分子进行任何交换俘虏的活动。

value.def: If you exchange something, you replace it with a different thing, especially something that is better or more satisfactory.

example.ex: ...the chance to sell back or exchange goods...
example.tran: 回销或调换商品的机会

example.ex: If the car you have leased is clearly unsatisfactory, you can always exchange it for another.
example.tran: 如果你对租借的车明显不满意，可随时另换一辆。

value.tran: 调换，交换，更换（尤指更好或更令人满意的东西）

value.def: An exchange is a brief conversation, usually an angry one.

example.ex: There've been some bitter exchanges between the two groups.
example.tran: 两组之间发生过一些激烈的争吵。

value.tran: 短暂的交谈;（常指）口角，争吵

value.def: An exchange of fire, for example, is an incident in which people use guns or missiles against each other.

example.ex: There was an exchange of fire during which the gunman was wounded...
example.tran: 有过交火，其间那名持枪歹徒受伤了。

example.ex: This could intensify the risk of a nuclear exchange.
example.tran: 这可能会加剧爆发核战争的危险。

value.def: An exchange is an arrangement in which people from two different countries visit each other's country, to strengthen links between them.

example.ex: ...a series of sporting and cultural exchanges with Seoul...
example.tran: 和首尔之间的一系列体育和文化交流
面向年轻人的教育交流

example.ex: I'm going to go on an exchange visit to Paris.

value.tran: （不同国家人们之间的）交流，互访

value.def: Exchange is used in the names of some places where people used to trade and do business with each other.
The exchange is the same as the telephone exchange .
If you do or give something in exchange for something else, you do it or give it in order to get that thing.

example.ex: It is illegal for public officials to solicit gifts or money in exchange for favors...
example.tran: 公务员通过索要礼物或钱财作为为他人提供便利的交换是违法的。

example.ex: He paid her a huge salary. In exchange, he was assured of her vote.
example.tran: 他给她支付了很高的薪水，作为交换，他确定能够得到她的选票。

gramarinfo.label: usu PHR <l>for</l> n, PHR with cl
